API_675.document_title: CENTRIFUGAL PUMPS API 610 11TH EDITION DATA SHEET SI UNITS

process_notes.text: See Project Design Data, document no. DRP001-PUC-SPE-U-000-002 latest revision, for site conditions, meteorological data and available utilities.
NPSH Datum is pump centerline at 1,01 m above grade.

The available NPSH shall exceed the NPSHr by 2,0 m up to pump rated capacity. The NPSHr shall be lower than the NPSHA by at least 0.5 m from the rated point of the pump up to 125% of rated flow. NPSHA@125% = 8,65 m.
One pump is working and one pump is standby.

text.introduction: Refer to Project Design Data DRP001-PUC-SPE-U-000-002 latest revision for cooling water conditions. According to this document, cooling water conditions are the following:

cooling_water_return_outlet.title: Cooling water return, outlet from equipment:

other_requirements.title: Other requirements:
other_requirements.cooling_water_delta_t: Cooling Water Delta T = 10 °C. vendor has to adjust to this delta.
other_requirements.max_allowable_pressure_drop: Maximum allowable pressure drop through package: 0.5 kg/cm2g (referred to grade level).
other_requirements.expected_consumption: Expected consumption of Cooling Water for each pump is 2.5 m3/h.

process_notes.text: Minimum flow corresponds to Turndown Operation: 45% of Normal Flowrate.
Insulation for Process reason: Heat conservation
Stand by pump warm up is planned with bypass to keep downstream line flowing.

mechanical_notes.text: In accordance with DRP001-PUC-SPE-M-000-007 - work area limit code for train is G1 - 85 dBA @ 1 m for complete train.

Pump Max. discharge pressure is 60.8 kg/cm2g considering max. specific gravity (0.793), max. suction pressure of 52.92 kg/cm2g and shut-off differential head of 95,3 m and 5% head increase by increasing impeller according project requirement, and not including API 610 test tolerances. System design pressure is 62.6 kg/cm2g @ 290°C.

Mechanical shaft seals must be according API 682 4 th edition and DRP001-PUC-SPE-R-000-015. Selection for flushing & auxiliary system components (valves, instruments, pipe schedule, flange ratings, etc) in accordance with pump MAWP at design temperature (refer to API 682 sec. 8.1.4). Refer to mechanical seal data sheet with selection 21A-LIN-060-23/61.

Pump shall be capable of withstanding double the forces and moments in table 5 from API 610 11th, amended by DRP001-PUC-SPE-R-000-005 p. 6.5, without causing an internal rub or adversely affecting pumps or seal operation.

Couplings, coupling-to-shaft junctures and any other torque transmission component shall be suitable to withstand transient peak torque following momentary voltage dips (100% residual voltage and out-of-phase switchgear re-closure).
No hazardous Service Category according 3.1.96 of Project Specification DRP001-PUC-SPE-R-000-015.

Due to the high suction pressure that leads to a high axial thrust, Vendor will check thrust bearing type, mechanical seal Type and the hydraulic arrangement of the pump. Apart from that, Vendor will indicate power at rated point and the power needed for the starting up of the pump (special requirement of the seal and of the bearings due to high suction pressure). Vendor will also indicate starting torque of the pump.

bearings_and_lubrication.text: Inpro seals bearing isolators to be provided on pump bearing housing.

motor_driver.text: Main driver motor shall be in accordance to IEC 60034 and aplicable project specification DRP001-PUC-SPE-E-000-009
Motor sized for automatic start with the discharge valve open and ability to meet end-of-curve power requirements
Transverse and axial alignment positioning jackscrews shall be provided for drive train components with mass greater than 100 kg.

inspection_and_testing.text: Inspection and testing in accordance with project specification for API-610 centrifugal pumps DRP001-PUC-SPE-R-000-005 and Project specification for QA, QC/Inspection DRP001-PUC-PRO-N-000-004.
An NPSH3 test shall be required where the NPSHA and NPSH3 difference is less than 2.5 m up to the rated capacity. Also if beyond rated capacity the NPSH margin is less than 0.7m.

text.nde_requirements: Refer to DRP001-PUC-SPE-R-000-005 parag. 8.2.1.3 for additional parts NDE requeriments (shafts, balance drums/piston, and sleeves).
